content.question: A point charge of <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mstyle></math> is a distance <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the center of a conducting sphere of charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mstyle></math> and radius <math alttext="uppercase R less than lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>R</mi><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements about the charge distribution on the sphere is correct?

choices.label: The <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mstyle></math> charge is evenly distributed about the surface of the sphere.
There is a net positive charge on the right half of the sphere.
There is a net negative charge on the sphere.
There is a net negative charge on the right half of the sphere.

content.answer: There is a net positive charge on the right half of the sphere.
